refnamediv.refpurpose: Allows a floating-point 14-bit MIDI signal scaled with a minimum and a maximum range.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Allows a floating-point 14-bit MIDI signal scaled with a minimum and a maximum range.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: idest midic14 ictlno1, ictlno2, imin, imax [, ifn]
kdest midic14 ictlno1, ictlno2, kmin, kmax [, ifn]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: imin -- user-defined minimum floating-point value of output
imax -- user-defined maximum floating-point value of output
ifn (optional) -- table to be read when indexing is required. Table must be normalized. Output is scaled according to imin and imax values.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: kmin -- user-defined minimum floating-point value of output
kmax -- user-defined maximum floating-point value of output

midic14 (i- and k-rate 14 bit MIDI control) allows a floating-point 14-bit MIDI signal scaled with a minimum and a maximum range. The minimum and maximum values can be varied at k-rate. It can use optional interpolated table indexing. It requires two MIDI controllers as input.

note.para: Please note that the midic family of opcodes are designed for MIDI triggered events, and don't require a channel number since they will respond to the same channel as the one that triggered the instrument (see massign). However they will crash if called from a score driven event.
